intro: Alysicarpus pokleanus, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves with small, heart-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume, containing several seeds, and it is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions. Alysicarpus pokleanus is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some traditional agricultural systems.
